summary: Frontend testing PASSED - All NEW Yagi Element Position Adjustment features verified successfully
passed_tests: Yagi Array Mode toggle enables/disables Yagi configuration panel - PASS
Position Adjust sliders appear for all 5 Yagi elements (ANT1, ANT2, DIR1, DIR2, DIR3) when Yagi mode is ON - PASS
Each position slider has range -12 to +12 inches with step=1 - PASS
ANT1 position slider: min=-12, max=12, step=1 - PASS
ANT2 position slider: min=-12, max=12, step=1 - PASS
DIR1 position slider: min=-12, max=12, step=1 - PASS
DIR2 position slider: min=-12, max=12, step=1 - PASS
DIR3 position slider: min=-12, max=12, step=1 - PASS
Moving position sliders changes displayed offset value correctly - PASS
Negative offset values show RED color (-8", -4") - PASS
Positive offset values show GREEN color (+10", +7") - PASS
Zero offset values show NEUTRAL/slate color (0") - PASS
SWR changes when element positions are adjusted - PASS (1.0 at zero → 2.3-3.0 with offsets)
SWR returns to 1.0 when all positions reset to 0 - PASS
SWR calculation reflects spacing changes: ANT2=+12 → SWR=2.3, multiple offsets → SWR up to 3.0 - PASS
Height sliders for ANT1, ANT2, DIR1 still work correctly - PASS
DIR1 Position toggle (On Truck / Front Beam) still works - PASS
Canvas visualizer shows Yagi array with elements at adjusted positions - PASS
Canvas shows offset labels when elements have non-zero positions - PASS
critical_code_review_comments: yagiElementPositions state correctly added to DEFAULT_STATE in RFContext.js with initial values for all 5 elements
calculateYagiSWR() in rfEngine.js properly includes elementPositions parameter and calculates spacing-based SWR penalties
Position sliders use correct data-testid format: yagi-pos-{elementId}-slider for all 5 elements
Color coding logic correctly applies text-red-400 for negative, text-green-400 for positive, text-slate-600 for zero
Canvas drawYagiArray() function correctly uses posOffsets to position elements and draw offset labels
getYagiRadiationPattern() also accounts for elementPositions affecting beam width and side lobes
context_for_next_testing_agent: All Yagi element position adjustment features working correctly: 1) 5 position sliders (ANT1-DIR3) with -12 to +12 inch range, 2) Color-coded offset values (red=negative, green=positive, neutral=zero), 3) SWR properly increases when elements are moved from 0 position (tests showed SWR going from 1.0 to 2.3-3.0), 4) SWR returns to 1.0 when positions reset, 5) Canvas shows Yagi array with adjusted element positions and offset labels, 6) Height sliders and DIR1 Position toggle continue to work alongside new position sliders
